input.description: MVP prediction oracle with smart contract and web interface. BTC price predictions, staking mechanism, user dashboard, pinky mascot animations

spiralAnalysis.breakthroughInsight: Understanding economics drives implementation, not vice versa

domainAnalysis.recommendation:
BALANCED COMPLEXITY.

Domain complexity (7/10) ≈ Technical (7/10).

Recommended Approach:
1. Start with domain-first understanding (70% effort)
2. Simultaneously validate technical feasibility (30% effort)
3. Build POC for highest-risk technical assumption
4. Use POC + domain clarity to finalize architecture

actionPriority.action: Build 1-session POC for each high-risk assumption
Design full architecture based on POC learnings

criticalAssumptions.assumption: Is blockchain necessary vs traditional database?
criticalAssumptions.validation: Compare blockchain vs centralized data model

criticalAssumptions.assumption: Can we reliably detect patterns in user behavior?
criticalAssumptions.validation: Implement pattern detection on sample data

pocAnalysis.pocPlan:
POC Plan:

POC 1: Is blockchain necessary vs traditional database?
  Validation: Compare blockchain vs centralized data model
  Duration: 1 session
  Risk: HIGH

POC 2: Can we reliably detect patterns in user behavior?
  Validation: Implement pattern detection on sample data
  Duration: 1 session
  Risk: HIGH

Total POC Time: 2 sessions (1-3 weeks)
Expected Outcome: 3-4x confidence multiplier on each validated assumption

pocAnalysis.recommendation:
Few critical assumptions (2).

Recommended: Build quick 1-session POC for each before full commitment.
Time investment: 1-2 weeks
Confidence gain: 3-4x

criticalIntegrationPoints: User session state across distributed components
integrationAnalysis.recommendation:
INTEGRATION COMPLEXITY ANALYSIS

Components Average: 6.5/10
Integration Complexity: 10/10
Multiplier Effect: ×1.75

Underestimation Warning: You will likely underestimate integration by 3.5 points (54%).

Why This Happens:
- Components can be built independently
- Integration reveals hidden coupling/state issues
- Testing integration is harder than testing components
- Edge cases emerge at integration boundaries

Impact: Typical integration takes 154% longer than estimated.

recommended.name: Integration Layer First
recommended.description: Design integration architecture BEFORE building components

recommended.name: State Management Upfront
recommended.description: Define how components share state before implementation

alternatives.name: Contract Testing
alternatives.description: Define component contracts early, test integration points

alternatives.name: Staged Integration
alternatives.description: Integrate one component at a time, test thoroughly

sideProjectAnalysis.triggerCondition: When main project blocked for 3-4+ sessions without breakthrough
sideProjectAnalysis.expectedOutput: Knowledge artifact applicable to main project + 2-3 future projects
sideProjectAnalysis.roi: 3-5x (each side project unlocks multiple future projects)
sideProjectAnalysis.recommendation:
No high-severity blockers detected.

Side projects are optional but recommended when:
- Main project progression slows (stalled for 3-4+ sessions)
- A specific technical challenge needs deep exploration
- Cross-cutting knowledge could benefit multiple projects

When ready, create focused 1-2 week side project to advance knowledge.

frameworkAnalysis.willAddress: Validating signature patterns across multiple domains
frameworkAnalysis.triggerCondition: Around session 12, month 16 when integration complexity crystallizes

frameworkEvolutionPath.name: Clarification Phase
frameworkEvolutionPath.expectedInsight: Confirm or refine spiral count accuracy

frameworkEvolutionPath.name: Synthesis Phase
frameworkEvolutionPath.expectedInsight: Principle for executing at highest speed + quality

frameworkAnalysis.recommendation:
First project analysis!

Framework Prediction: Emerging framework will validate Magnus 14 patterns.

Recommendation:
- Document every decision and outcome
- Note when spiral counts deviate from predictions
- Track what assumptions hold true vs surprise you
- Use learnings to refine Magnus 14 for next project

After this project: You'll have data to validate/refine Magnus 14 accuracy.
